holidays.name: Workaholics Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate those who live to work, not just work to live! It's a tongue-in-cheek homage to overachievers who proudly burn the midnight oil.
holidays.origin: This unofficial holiday emerged from internet culture and office humor to poke fun at excessive work habits.
holidays.funFact: Workaholics Day is ironically a perfect excuse to take a break from work and relax!

holidays.name: National Bikini Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the iconic two-piece swimsuit that revolutionized beach fashion and women‚Äôs swimwear!
holidays.origin: Commemorates the day in 1946 when the bikini was introduced by French engineer Louis R√©ard.
holidays.funFact: The bikini was named after Bikini Atoll, where nuclear testing was taking place, implying it would create an "explosive" reaction in fashion.

holidays.name: Gingerbread Day
holidays.description: A sweet celebration of the spicy, sugary cookie that‚Äôs often shaped like little men, houses, or hearts.
holidays.origin: Gingerbread dates back to ancient times, but July 5th is a quirky nod to gingerbread lovers craving a mid-year treat.
holidays.funFact: Gingerbread was once used as a form of currency in Medieval Europe because it was so valuable!

holidays.name: Jacksonville Jumbo Shrimp Day
holidays.description: A quirky local day honoring Jacksonville‚Äôs beloved minor league baseball team ‚Äî the Jumbo Shrimp!
holidays.origin: Celebrated since 2009 in Jacksonville, Florida, spotlighting the city‚Äôs fun team name and community spirit.
holidays.funFact: The Jumbo Shrimp team name was chosen to be both memorable and a playful oxymoron!
